english: "Although Tom and Mary are living together, they are only friends." "How do you know that they're only friends?" "Because they're both in relationships with different people." "Huh? That can't be ideal. If I were her, I'd hate it."

english: "Are you married?" "Yeah I am." "Huh. Are you by chance expecting children or such?" "I am, but is there a reason you're asking?" "No, nothing at all." "More than that though, could you please stop speaking like you're a smelt."

japanese: あいつの家族はみんなアメリカに行ったんだけど、あいつはブラジルに残ったんだ。
english: All his family went to the United States, but he stayed in Brazil.

japanese: リオデジャネイロに来たら教えて。僕がガイドするよ。
english: In case you go to Rio, let me know. I'd like to be your guide.

japanese: いくら文句言ったって、何も変わりゃしないよ。
english: No matter how much you complain, it's not going to change anything.

japanese: どんなに文句言おうが、何も変わんないさ。
english: No matter how much you complain, it's not going to change anything.

japanese: 卵がテーブルから落ちてさぁ、言うまでもなく割れちゃったよ。
english: The egg fell from the table and, obviously, broke.

japanese: トムは断食明けの祭りをとても楽しみにしています。
english: Tom looks forward to celebrating Eid ul-Fitr to mark the end of the fast.

japanese: レチェ・フリータって食べたことある？僕が一番好きなデザートなんだけど。
english: Have you ever tried fried milk? It's my favorite dessert.

japanese: ミルクを固めて揚げるというのは、想像がつきません。
english: I can't imagine what fried frozen milk would be like.

japanese: そのメロディって、どっかで聞いたことがるよ。
english: I've already heard that melody somewhere.

japanese: 妻と話すために、新しい言葉を学ぶ必要があった。
english: I had to learn a new language to talk with my wife.

japanese: 妻と会話ができるように、新しい言葉を習わないといけなかったんだ。
english: I had to learn a new language to talk with my wife.

japanese: 誰かを愛するか憎むかでは、どちらが簡単？
english: Is it easier to love or hate someone?

japanese: 昇格したばかりです！
english: I just got promoted!

japanese: ヤニーの目の周りに黒あざがあるの。
english: Yanni has black eyes.

japanese: 鶏肉は調理前に必ず解凍してください。
english: Make sure to thaw the chicken out before cooking.

japanese: 彼女は電子レンジで肉を解凍することにした。
english: She decided to thaw the meat in the microwave.

japanese: ここで待ってて。すぐ戻ってくるから。
english: Wait for me here. I'll be right back.

japanese: 昨日、刑務所から三人の男が脱走しました。
english: Three men escaped from prison yesterday.

japanese: そんな生活をするぐらいなら、死んだほうがマシだ。
english: It'd be better to die than live a life like that.

japanese: この単語の意味が分からないんだ。
english: I don't understand the meaning of this word.

japanese: 明日は時間があるかどうか分かんないな。
english: I don't know if I'll have time tomorrow.

japanese: 最後にもう一つ質問があります。
english: I have one last question for you.

japanese: 俺のカード使った？
english: Did you buy something with my credit card?

japanese: 俺のカードでなんか買った？
english: Did you buy something with my credit card?

japanese: お昼はお母さんいないから、冷蔵庫にあるご飯とおかずをレンジでチンして食べてね。
english: Mum isn't going to be home for lunch, so you should microwave some rice and side dishes from the fridge.

japanese: それって、個人的な問題のようね。
english: That sounds like a personal problem.

japanese: 図書館に新刊が入りました。
english: Our library got some new books in.

japanese: 今日は暖かかったね。

japanese: 今日は耐えがたい暑さだな。

japanese: 「ネクタイどれにするの？」「昨日買ったの」
english: "What tie are you putting on?" "The one I bought yesterday."

japanese: 声がもっと可愛かったらいいのに。
english: I wish my voice was cuter.

japanese: もっとかわいい声だったらいいのにな。
english: I wish my voice was cuter.

japanese: 電気自動車の充電には、結構な時間がかかります。
english: Charging the electric car takes a very long time.

japanese: 電気自動車の充電って、めちゃくちゃ時間がかかるのよ。

english: I'll teach you French if you teach me English.

japanese: 日本語を教えてくれたら、スペイン語を教えてあげるよ。
english: I'll teach you Spanish if you teach me Japanese.

english: We haven't changed our minds.

japanese: トムとは一緒には踊ってないわよ。
english: Tom and I didn't dance together.

english: "I like playing cards." "Me too."

japanese: マヤ暦には、19の月があります。
english: The Mayan calendar has 19 months.

english: "Is today Wednesday?" "Look at the calendar."

japanese: ユリウス暦で、今日は何月何日？
english: What day is it today on the Julian calendar?

english: Lemons planted in pots are smaller than those planted in the ground.

japanese: 月に３時間以上使用すると、追加料金がかかります。
english: If you use it more than three hours a month, there are extra charges.

japanese: 月に３時間以上使った場合、超過料金がかかります。
english: If you use it more than three hours a month, there are extra charges.

japanese: メアリーはポッドキャスターです。

english: If you sleep in your underwear during winter, you'll catch a cold.

japanese: 姉は1人しかいません。

japanese: あいつには電話しなくていいよ。

japanese: 僕の弟、見かけなかった？

japanese: 文自体は悪くないんだけど、ネイティブは自分自身をそんな風には言わないよ。なので、こういう風に書くのがいいんじゃないかな。
english: The sentence itself isn't wrong, but natives wouldn't express themselves like that. So I suggest you write it like this.

japanese: 文自体は悪くありませんが、ネイティブは自分自身をそのようには表現しないでしょう。ですから、私はこのように書くようにご提案します。
english: The sentence itself isn't wrong, but natives wouldn't express themselves like that. So I suggest you write it like this.

japanese: 4年前に買った自転車です。
english: I bought this bicycle four years ago.

japanese: 「トムのやつ、もうフランス語でラブレターも書けるようになったのかな？」「どうしてそんなこと聞くの？」「だって、あいつ、マリア・エマニュエルにぞっこんじゃん」「もしかして妬いてるの？」「そうだよ！それが何か？」
english: "Do you think Tom will be able to write love letters in French?" "Why do you ask?" "He's in love with Marie-Emmanuelle." "Perhaps you’re jealous?" "Yes, I am! Is something going on?

english: Dan arrived first.

english: When I went to the dentist, he told me to raise my hand whenever it hurt, but when I did he waved me off and told me to hang on a minute. So what was the point of him telling me that earlier?

japanese: これって、文なの？
english: Is this a sentence?

japanese: これは文ですか？
english: Is this a sentence?

japanese: これは文なんですか？
english: Is this a sentence?

japanese: 「これって文なの？」「違いますね。だけど、会話の一部としてなら使えますね。例えばこんな風に」「なるほどね。ありがとう」
english: "Is this a sentence?" "No, but it can be used as part of a dialogue. For example, like this." "Got it, thanks."

japanese: 「雪の彫刻」と言えば、「さっぽろ雪まつり」を思い出す。「さっぽろ雪まつり」一度は、行ってみたいな。
english: When you mentioned "snow carving", you reminded me of the "Sapporo snow festival". I'd love to go there one day.

english: August 12th is two days before Mary's birthday.

japanese: 8月は31日あります。

english: Since you keep speaking as if it were easy, I think it'd be better if you just did it yourself.

japanese: モスクワの出身ですよ。

japanese: ベルリン出身です。

japanese: 妻がおっかないんだ。

japanese: 自動ドアです。

japanese: ドアは自動で開きます。

japanese: ここの店、8時に開くの。

japanese: トムなら、図書館の外でメアリーを待ってたよ。
english: Tom was waiting outside the library for Mary.

japanese: 夫婦二人三脚で、このお店を切り盛りしてきました。
english: The married couple was able to run this store with their seamless teamwork.

japanese: 自分のペースで仕事がしたい。
english: I want to work at my own pace.

japanese: マイペースに仕事したい。
english: I want to work at my own pace.

english: Tom didn't go to work today.

japanese: 今日、トムは仕事に行きませんでした。
english: Tom didn't go to work today.

english: I didn't see Tom last night.

japanese: 後で話し合いましょう。
english: Let's discuss it later.

japanese: その後、皆でコーヒーをいただいた。
english: Everyone drank coffee afterwards.

japanese: 後で頼むよ。

japanese: 後で注文するわ。
